title: For Spouses of U.S. Citizens, Green Card Interviews End in Handcuffs
summary: Agents are arresting foreign-born spouses when they report for the final step to obtain permanent residency, and charging them with visa violations that could result in deportation.

title: Colorado Judge Tells Immigration Agents to Stop Arrests Without Warrants
summary: The ruling that immigration agents are acting illegally is the latest to rebuke the Trump administration’s tactics, but earlier orders have been blocked on appeal.

title: ICE Detains Mother of White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt’s Nephew
summary: Bruna Caroline Ferreira, the mother of a nephew of the White House press secretary, Karoline Leavitt, was pulled over and arrested on her way to pick up her son from school, Ms. Ferreira’s lawyer said.

title: U.S. to Press Europe and Other Allies on Immigration, Document Says
summary: American diplomats were told to raise U.S. concerns about “violent crimes associated with people of a migration background.”

title: ‘In Triage Every Day’: A Beleaguered Speaker Says He’s Overwhelmed
summary: In a podcast interview, Speaker Mike Johnson opened up about the crushing demands of a job that he joked was his in name only.

title: Signs of Fatigue: Trump Faces Realities of Aging in Office
summary: President Trump has always used his stamina and energy as a political strength. But that image is getting harder for him to sustain.

title: Trump Says South Africa Is Not Invited to G20 Summit in U.S. in 2026
summary: The president did not attend this year’s annual gathering in South Africa, which has been a frequent target of his attacks.

title: North Carolina Can Use Republican-Friendly Congressional Map, Court Says
summary: The district court ruling means that the party is one step closer to securing another seat in the U.S. House and retaining its majority, at the urging of President Trump.

title: What to Know About the Fire at a Hong Kong Apartment Complex
summary: Firefighters struggled to contain the blaze in the high-rise buildings. At least 36 people were killed, and many more were feared trapped inside the towers.

title: Five-Ingredient, Easy Thanksgiving Recipes
summary: Turkey, potatoes and dessert don’t need to be fussy. Keep the shopping and cooking simple so you can enjoy the day.

title: What the Pentagon’s Attack Videos Reveal About the Boat Strikes at Sea
summary: The military has released 21 video clips of U.S. attacks on vessels it says are trafficking drugs. But they tell only part of the story.

title: Marriages, Kids, Careers: For 44 Years, They’ve Been Talking It Out
summary: Six women in their 70s, all married and all mothers and grandmothers, gather twice a month without fail. They credit their close-knit families to their longstanding friendships.

title: U.S. Army Secretary’s Unusual Role in Ukraine Peace Negotiations
summary: Daniel Driscoll has met with Ukrainian and Russian officials during a whirlwind of trips as the Trump administration pushes its latest proposal.

title: Top U.S. Negotiator Warned Europeans That Russia Is Stockpiling Missiles
summary: Daniel P. Driscoll, the U.S. Army secretary, used the growing threat from Moscow as a way to sell a quick peace deal unfavorable to Ukraine.

title: Differences Over Health Care and Ukraine Roil a Chaotic G.O.P. Congress
summary: Republican lawmakers and the White House have unloaded on one another as post-shutdown tension over policy and performance spreads across Capitol Hill.

title: Detroit Has Its Own Thanksgiving Parade. The City Gets Bigheaded About It.
summary: The march down Woodward Avenue, which endured through the city’s hardest years, features papier-mâché caricatures that are uniquely Detroit.

title: Broadway Performers Rehearse for the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade
summary: We tagged along to a late-night rehearsal for performers from “Just in Time,” “Buena Vista Social Club” and “Ragtime.”

title: How to Watch the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade
summary: The 99th edition of the New York parade will feature performances from Cynthia Erivo and Busta Rhymes, as well as dozens of floats and balloons.

title: Did the Giant Heads of Easter Island Once Walk?
summary: Scholars have long debated how the massive stone figures of Rapa Nui got to where they stand today. A new study offers one possible explanation.

title: Disney’s ‘Zootopia 2’ Will Be a Test for Jared Bush
summary: Jared Bush is trying to make the heart of the media empire beat more consistently. “Zootopia 2” will be a test.

title: ‘Zootopia 2’ Review: Natural Habitats, Expanded
summary: A sequel to the 2016 hit, this movie about an animal metropolis takes on an even messier social allegory than the first one, while building out a wider (if bloated) universe.

title: Larry Bushart Posted a Charlie Kirk Meme. He Went to Jail for 37 Days.
summary: The best way to honor Charlie Kirk is not to criminalize speech.

title: The Loneliness of Using a Faith-Based Chatbot
summary: Faith is not meant to be transactional or tailored to you.

title: Dubrovnik, Known for Its Beauty, Faces a Mound of New Trash
summary: Officials in Dubrovnik, Croatia, say the strong currents of the Adriatic Sea washed ashore a vast amount of garbage, mostly from Albania, during a recent storm.

title: As Trade Talks Stall, Carney Moves to Shield Canada from Trump Tariffs
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney announced curbs on steel imports, a new tariff and help with steel and lumber freight costs in a bid to aid Canadian industries.

title: Thanksgiving Storm: Blizzard Warnings Across Upper Midwest Warn of Heavy Snow
summary: At least one death was connected to the storm, which was expected to be unusually intense, even for areas used to heavy snow.

title: David Lerner, a Mr. Fix-it of Apple Computers, Dies at 72
summary: He and a partner founded Tekserve, a Manhattan emergency room for frozen hard drives, keyboards, screens and their confounded owners.
